title: How to Find Profitable Keywords and Niches With Publisher Rocket

tactics.name: Spreadsheet Tracking
tactics.description: Track keywords using a spreadsheet with fields like niche, keyword type, BSR ranking, and book count under 150k BSR.
steps: Drill into Amazon categories for niche keywords
caveats: Avoid overly broad categories with high competition
example_niches: ABC coloring book for kids ages 3 to 5
source_quotes: I've got this one that I've made up it's got either Niche or main keyword... number of books under 150,000 BSR on the first page

tactics.name: Keyword Search
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket's keyword search to analyze competition and volume.
steps: Identify long-tail keywords with lower competition
caveats: Avoid keywords with over 20,000 results initially
source_quotes: ABC coloring book... we need to reduce that down to two 2,000 or so

tactics.name: Keyword Refinement
tactics.description: Reduce search results to 2,000 by balancing keyword length and search volume
steps: Filter to medium-tail keywords like 'farm animals coloring book'
Check competitive scores and monthly search volume
caveats: Avoid overly long-tail keywords with <100 monthly searches
source_quotes: if we look at these books here there's there's plenty that are that are doing quite well but I just feel there's far too many

tactics.name: Keyword-Niche Mapping
tactics.description: Identify profitable niches by analyzing top-performing books' titles, descriptions, and reviews to extract keywords and themes
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to filter books by category and sales rank
Analyze titles and descriptions for recurring keywords
Check review counts and ratings for validation
Create content around validated keywords and themes
caveats: Requires content creation effort for sustained income
source_quotes: these books are making um where are we further up 3,000 $35,000 per month

heuristics.name: Low Review Filter
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: we need to reduce that down to two 2,000 or so because if we look at these books here there's there's plenty that are that are doing quite well but I just feel there's far too

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
source_quotes: we can have a look at the monthly sales we can see the number of pages

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Boost
heuristics.condition: If a niche has low review counts but high growth potential, prioritize it
source_quotes: children's and youth sports category is currently tracking up

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket costs $199 for lifetime access with continuous updates.
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket $199 it's a oneoff payment and you get lifetime access

claims.statement: Board books cannot be created on Amazon
source_quotes: we can't create board books on Amazon

claims.statement: Children and Youth Sports category shows 8% monthly growth with low competition
source_quotes: children's and youth sports category is currently tracking up

niche_patterns.example: ABC coloring book + kids ages 3 to 5
niche_patterns.description: Combine product type with specific audience needs and limitations to create targeted niches.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Reduces competition while targeting underserved markets
source_quotes: ABC coloring book for kid kids Age 3 to 5... we need to reduce that down to two 2,000 or so

niche_patterns.description: Combine sports themes with audience-specific content for targeted niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages popular sports keywords with audience-specific engagement
source_quotes: inspirational baseball stories for kids so they're popular
